Process a text.

Source: R/process_text.R
process_text.Rd

Process a list of text or character vector by converting to lowercase, replacing contractions, removing numbers and punctuation, and stemming/lemmatising.

process_text(text = NULL, lower = TRUE, contractions = FALSE,
  remove_numbers = TRUE, punctuation = TRUE, remove_words = FALSE,
  lemmatise = FALSE, stem = FALSE)

Arguments

text

The text to be processed.
lower

Convert text to lowercase (TRUE/FALSE).
contractions

Replace contracted words in the text (TRUE/FALSE). If true, 'contractions_dict' will be used.
remove_numbers

Remove numbers in the text (TRUE/FALSE).
punctuation

Remove punctuation in the text (TRUE/FALSE/regex).
remove_words

Remove words in the text (TRUE/FALSE/character vector). If true, 'smart_stopwords' will be used.
lemmatise

Lemmatise the text.
stem

Stem the text.

Value

The processed text as a dataframe

Details

This function is a short, personalised wrapper for many tedious text processing tasks like removing characters or patterns. For more formatting and text processing, see qdap by Tyler Rinker, or tm.

See also

mine_text replace_contractions

Examples

text <- c("I don't want to process this comment!", "I'm v serious.")
process_text(text, contractions = TRUE)
#> [1] "i dont want to process this comment" "im very serious"                    
process_text(text, contractions = TRUE, punctuation = "[^,.[:^punct:]]+")
#> [1] "i dont want to process this comment" "im very serious."
